meanings.definition: To deal with (a problem or difficult task)
meanings.sent1: She had to tackle the challenging math problem.
meanings.sent2: He decided to tackle the messy room before dinner.
meanings.sent3: Trying to tackle the huge pile of laundry felt like a never-ending battle.
meanings.sent4: She tackled the project head-on and completed it ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent5: With determination, he tackled the obstacle course and emerged victorious.

meanings.definition: A piece of equipment used in fishing or football
meanings.sent1: The fisherman grabbed his tackle box before heading to the lake.
meanings.sent2: The football player carried his tackle onto the field.
meanings.sent3: The shiny new fishing tackle gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The football coach organized the team's tackle neatly in the equipment room.
meanings.sent5: She carefully selected the perfect tackle for her fishing trip.

meanings.definition: To grab and hold onto someone in order to stop them from moving
meanings.sent1: The defender tried to tackle the running back during the game.
meanings.sent2: He quickly tackled his friend to prevent him from falling.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully tackled each other in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: She had to tackle her dog to put on its leash for a walk.
meanings.sent5: The security guard tackled the thief before he could escape.
